lemma distributive_property_of_multiplication:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * c = a * c + b * c"
  by (auto simp: field_simps)

theorem algebra_2rootspoly_apatapbeq2asqp2ab:
  fixes a b :: complex
  shows "(a+a) * (a+b) = 2 * a^2 + 2 * (a*b)"
proof -
  have "(a+a) * (a+b) = 2*a * (a+b)"
    using distributive_property_of_multiplication[of a a b]
    by simp
  also have "... = 2*a^2 + 2*a*b"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem algebra_2rootspoly_apatapbeq2asqp2ab:
  fixes a b :: complex
  shows "(a+a) * (a+b) = 2 * a^2 + 2 * (a*b)"
proof -
  have lhs: "(a+a) * (a+b) = (2*a) * (a+b)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  have lhs_eq: "(2*a) * (a+b) = 2*a^2 + 2*(a*b)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  have rhs_eq: "2 * a^2 + 2 * (a*b) = 2 * a^2 + 2 * (a*b)"
    by simp
  show ?thesis using lhs_eq rhs_eq
    by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_182:
  fixes y:: complex
  shows "7*(3*y+2) = 21 * y + 14"
proof -
  have "7*(3*y+2) = 7*3*y + 7*2" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "7*(3*y+2) = 21*y + 14" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_182_extended:
  fixes x y:: complex
  shows "(x + 7)*(3*y+2) = 3*x*y + 21 * y + 2*x + 14"
proof -
  have "(x + 7)*(3*y+2) = (x * (3*y+2)) + (7 * (3*y+2))" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "(x + 7)*(3*y+2) = (3*x*y + 2*x) + (21 * y + 14)" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem algebra_2rootspoly_apatapbeq2asqp2ab:

  fixes a b :: complex

theorem algebra_manipexpr_apbeq2cceqiacpbceqm2:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes h0 : "a+b = 2*c"
    and h1 : "c = \<i>"
  shows "a*c+b*c=-2"
proof -
  have "a+b = 2*\<i>"
    using assms(1,2) by auto
  then have "(a+b)*c = (2*\<i>) * c"
    by (simp add: h1)
  then have "a*c+b*c = 2*\<i>*c"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a*c+b*c = -2"
    by (metis complex_i_mult_minus dbl_def dbl_simps(3) h0 h1 mult.commute mult_2 mult_2_right)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma complex_multiplication:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * c = a * c + b * c"
  by (auto simp: field_simps)

theorem algebra_manipexpr_apbeq2cceqiacpbceqm2:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes h0 : "a + b = 2 * c"
    and h1 : "c = \<i>"
  shows "a * c + b * c = -2"
proof -
  have "a + b = 2 * \<i>"
    using assms(1,2) by auto
  then have "(a + b) * c = (2 * \<i>) * c"
    by (simp add: h1)
  then have "a * c + b * c = 2 * \<i> * c"
    by (simp add: complex_multiplication)
  then have "a * c + b * c = -2"
    by (simp add: h1 power2_eq_square)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem algebra_add_eq_mult_plus_one:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes "b + c = -a" "a \<noteq> -1"
  shows "(b + 1) / (a + 1) + (c + 1) / (a + 1) = (b + c + 2) / (a + 1)"
proof -
  have "(b + 1) / (a + 1) + (c + 1) / (a + 1) = (b + c + 2) / (a + 1)"
    by (simp add: add_divide_distrib assms(2) field_simps)
  thus ?thesis using assms by simp
qed

lemma square_expression:
  fixes a b :: complex
  shows "(-a + -b)^2 = a^2 + 2*a*b + b^2"
proof -
  have "(-a + -b)^2 = (-a)^2 + 2 * (-a) * (-b) + (-b)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  also have "... = a^2 + 2 * a * b + b^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

data/full_data/valid/algebra_2varlineare:
theorem mathd_algebra_35:
  fixes p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. p x = 2 - x^2"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (x\<noteq>0) \<Longrightarrow> q x = 6 / x"
  shows "p (q 2) = -7"
proof -
  have "q 2 = 6 / 2" using h1 by auto
  then have "q 2 = 3" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = p 3" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 3^2" using h0 by auto
  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 9" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = -7" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_37:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=7"
    and h1 : "3 * x + y = 45"
  shows "x^2 - y^2 = 217"
proof -
  have eq0: "x = 19" using assms by auto
  have eq1: "y = -12" using assms eq0 by auto
  have "x^2 - y^2 = 19^2 - (-12)^2" using eq0 eq1 by simp
  then have "x^2 - y^2 = 217" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_37:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=7"
    and h1 : "3 * x + y = 45"
  shows "x^2 - y^2 = 217"
proof -
  have "x^2 - y^2 = (x+y) * (x-y)" by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = 7 * (x-y)" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = 7 * (x - (45 - 3 * x))" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = 7 * (4 * x - 45)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 28 * x - 315" by simp
  finally have "x^2 - y^2 = 28 * x - 315" .
  moreover have "x = 19" using assms by simp
  ultimately have "x^2 - y^2 = 217" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed
data/full_data/valid/algebra_amgm_faxinr:
lemma am_gm:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x >= 0" "y >= 0"
  shows "x^2 + y^2 >= 2*x*y"
  using assms by (simp add: sum_squares_bound)

lemma am_gm_divide_form:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x > 0" "y > 0"
  shows "x/y + y/x >= 2"
proof -
  have c0:"sqrt(x/y) \<ge> 0"
    using assms by simp
  have c1:"sqrt(y/x) \<ge> 0"
    using assms by simp
  have "x/y + y/x >= 2 * sqrt(x/y) * sqrt(y/x)"
    using am_gm[of "sqrt(x/y)" "sqrt(y/x)"] c0 c1 by simp
   have "2 * sqrt(x/y) * sqrt(y/x) = 2 * sqrt(x/y * y/x)"
    by (metis ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) real_sqrt_mult times_divide_eq_right)
  then have "... = 2"
    using assms(1) assms(2) by fastforce
  show ?thesis
    using \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y * y / x) = 2\<close> \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y) * sqrt (y / x) = 2 * sqrt (x / y * y / x)\<close> \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y) * sqrt (y / x) \<le> x / y + y / x\<close> by presburger
qed

lemma square_root_simplification:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "x \<ge> 0"
  shows "(sqrt x)^2 = x"
  using assms real_sqrt_pow2 by auto

lemma am_gm:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x > 0" "y > 0"
  shows "(x + y)/2 \<ge> sqrt(x * y)"
  using assms by (metis arith_geo_mean_sqrt less_eq_real_def)

lemma multiply_inequality_positive:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<ge> b" "c > 0"
  shows "a * c \<ge> b * c"
proof -
  have "a \<ge> b" using assms by simp
  then have "a * c \<ge> b * c" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis .
qed

lemma square_nonnegative:
  fixes x :: real
  shows "0 \<le> x^2"
  by (simp add: zero_le_power2)

lemma square_positive:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "x \<noteq> 0"
  shows "0 < x^2"
  using assms square_nonnegative by auto

lemma amgm_inequality:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "(a + b) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (a * b)"
proof -
  have "(a - b)\<^sup>2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "a^2 + b^2 \<ge> 2 * a * b" by sos
  then have "(a + b)^2 / 4 \<ge> a * b" by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  then have "(a + b) / 2 \<ge> sqrt (a * b)" using assms by (metis arith_geo_mean_sqrt less_eq_real_def)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed
data/full_data/valid/algebra_apb4leq8ta4:
lemma cauchy_schwarz:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x > 0" "y > 0"
  shows "2*x*y \<le> x^2 + y^2"
proof -
  have "(x - y)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  hence "x^2 - 2*x*y + y^2 \<ge> 0" by (simp add: power2_diff)
  hence "2*x*y \<le> x^2 + y^2" by arith
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma combine_inequalities:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b"
  shows "a^4 + b^4 \<le> 8 * (a^4 + b^4)"
proof -
  have "a^4 + b^4 \<le> a^4 + b^4 + a^4 + b^4" by simp
  also have "... = 2 * (a^4 + b^4)" by simp
  also have "... \<le> 8 * (a^4 + b^4)" using assms by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem algebra_sqineq_4bap1lt4bsqpap1sq:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "4 * b * (a+1) \<le> 4 * b^2 + (a+1)^2"
proof -
  have "(a+1)^2 - 4*b*(a+1) + 4*b^2 = (a+1 - 2*b)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_diff)
  then have "(a+1)^2 - 4*b*(a+1) + 4*b^2 \<ge> 0"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma sum_of_two_squares:
  fixes x y :: real
  shows "x^2 + y^2 \<ge> 2 * x * y"
proof -
  have "(x - y)^2 \<ge> 0" by simp
  then have "x^2 + y^2 - 2 * x * y \<ge> 0" by (simp add: power2_diff)
  thus "x^2 + y^2 \<ge> 2 * x * y" by simp
qed

lemma combine_inequalities:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "0 < a \<and> 0 < b"
  shows "a^4 + b^4 \<le> 8 * (a^4 + b^4)"
proof -
  have "(a^4 + b^4) * (1 - 8) \<le> 0"
    using assms by sos
  then have "-7 * (a^4 + b^4) \<le> 0"
    by sos
  then have "a^4 + b^4 \<le> 8 * (a^4 + b^4)"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma algebra_sqineq_4bap1lt4bsqpap1sq:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "4 * b * (a+1) \<le> 4 * b^2 + (a+1)^2"
proof -
  have "0 \<le> (a+1 - 2*b)^2"
    by simp
  then have "0 \<le> (a+1)^2 - 4*b*(a+1) + 4*b^2"
    by sos
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed
data/full_data/valid/algebra_binomnegdis:
lemma quadratic_inequality:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "4 * b * (a + 1) \<le> 4 * b^2 + (a + 1)^2"
proof -
  have "(a + 1)^2 - 4 * b * (a + 1) + 4 * b^2 = (a + 1 - 2 * b)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_diff)
  then have "(a + 1)^2 - 4 * b * (a + 1) + 4 * b^2 \<ge> 0"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma algebra_sqineq_4bap1lt4bsqpap1sq:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "4 * b * (a+1) \<le> 4 * b^2 + (a+1)^2"
proof -
  have "(2*b - (a+1))^2 \<ge> 0"
    by simp
  then have "4 * b^2 - 4 * b * (a+1) + (a+1)^2 \<ge> 0"
    by (simp add: power2_diff)
  then show ?thesis
    by simp
qed

lemma algebra_sqineq_2at2pclta2c2p41pc:
  fixes a c :: real
  shows "2 * a * (2+c) \<le> a^2 + c^2 + 4 * (1+c)"
proof -
  have "2 * a * (2 + c) \<le> a^2 + c^2 + 4 * (1 + c)"
    by sos
  then have "a^2 + c^2 + 4 * (1 + c) - 2 * a * (2 + c) \<ge> 0"
    by auto
  then have "(a - 2)^2 + (c - 2)^2 \<ge> 0"
    by auto
  then show ?thesis
    by sos
qed

lemma algebra_sqineq_2at2pclta2c2p41pc_rearranged:
  fixes a c :: real
  shows "a^2 - 4 * a + c^2 - 4 * c + 8 \<ge> 0"
proof -
  have "(a - 2)^2 + (c - 2)^2 \<ge> 0"
    by auto
  then have "a^2 - 4 * a + c^2 - 4 * c + 8 \<ge> 0"
    by sos
  then show ?thesis
    by auto
qed

lemma rearrange_inequality:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "28 * a^2 - 10 * a + 1 \<ge> 0"
  using power2_diff[of "5 / 28" a]
  by sos

lemma algebra_sqineq_4bap1lt4bsqpap1sq:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "4 * b * (a+1) \<le> 4 * b^2 + (a+1)^2"
proof -
  have "(a+1)^2 - 4*b*(a+1) + 4*b^2 \<ge> 0"
    by sos
  then have "(a+1)^2 + 4*b^2 \<ge> 4*b*(a+1)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then show ?thesis
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
qed

lemma algebra_sqineq:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "(k * sqrt 2 * a * b)^2 \<le> k^2 * 2 * (a^2 + b^2)^2"
proof -
  have "(k * sqrt 2 * a * b)^2 = (k^2 * (sqrt 2)^2 * (a * b)^2)" by (simp add: power_mult_distrib)
  also have "... = k^2 * 2 * (a * b)^2" by simp
  also have "... \<le> k^2 * 2 * (a^2 + b^2)^2" by sos
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma complex_number_multiplication:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes h0 : "a + b = 2 * c"
    and h1 : "c = \<i>"
  shows "a*c + b*c = -2"
proof -
  have "(a + b) * c = (2 * c) * c"
    using assms(1,2) by auto
  then have "a * c + b * c = 2 * c^2"
    by (metis h0 h1 mult.commute mult_2 numeral_2_eq_2 power2_eq_square ring_class.ring_distribs(1))
  then have "a * c + b * c = -2"
    by (simp add: h1 power2_eq_square)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_35:
  fixes p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. p x = 2 - x^2"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (x\<noteq>0) \<Longrightarrow> q x = 6 / x"
  shows "p (q 2) = -7"
proof -
  have "q 2 = 6 / 2" using h1 by auto
  then have "q 2 = 3" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = p 3" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 3^2" using h0 by auto
  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 9" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = -7" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma complex_expression:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes h0: "a + b = 2 * c"
    and h1: "c = \<i>"
  shows "a * c + b * c = -2"
proof -
  have "a + b = 2 * \<i>"
    using assms(1,2) by auto
  then have "(a + b) * c = (2 * \<i>) * c"
    by (simp add: h1)
  then have "a * c + b * c = 2 * \<i> * c"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "a * c + b * c = -2"
    by (simp add: h1 power2_eq_square)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem algebra_manipexpr_apbeq2cceqiacpbceqm2:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes h0 : "a+b = 2*c"
    and h1 : "c = \<i>"
  shows "a*c+b*c=-2"
proof -
  have "a+b = 2*\<i>"
    using assms(1,2) by auto
  then have "(a+b)*c = (2*\<i>) * c"
    by (simp add: h1)
  then have "a*c+b*c = 2*\<i>*c"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "a*c+b*c = -2"
    by (metis complex_i_mult_minus dbl_def dbl_simps(3) h0 h1 mult.commute mult_2 mult_2_right)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

lemma multi_distrib_complex:
  fixes a b c d :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d"
  by (simp add: distrib_left distrib_right)

lemma inverse_divide_cancel:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(1 / a) * (b / 1) = b / a"
proof -
  have "(1 / a) * (b / 1) = (1 / a) * b" by simp
  also have "... = b * (1 / a)" by (simp add: mult.commute)
  also have "... = b / a" by (simp add: divide_simps assms)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma log_to_power:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0: "a > 0" and h1: "a \<noteq> 1" and h2: "b > 0" and h3: "log a b = c"
  shows "b = a powr c"
by (metis assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) assms(4) powr_log_cancel powr_realpow)

lemma log_value:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes h0: "a > 0" and h1: "a \<noteq> 1" and h2: "b > 0" and h3: "log a b = c"
  shows "b = a powr c"
proof -
  have "log a b = log a (a powr c)" using assms by simp
  then have "log a b = c * log a a" using assms by (simp add: log_nat_power)
  then have "log a b = c" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis using assms by auto
qed

lemma inverse_divide_cancel:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(1 / a) * (b / 1) = b / a"
  using assms by (simp add: divide_simps)

theorem algebra_sqineq_4bap1lt4bsqpap1sq:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "b > 0"
  shows "4 * b * (a+1) \<le> 4 * b^2 + (a+1)^2"
proof -
  have "(a+1)^2 - 4*b*(a+1) + 4*b^2 = (a+1 - 2*b)^2"

  then have "(a+1 - 2*b)^2 \<ge> 0"
    by simp
  then have "(a+1)^2 - 4*b*(a+1) + 4*b^2 \<ge> 0"
    by sos
  then show ?thesis
    using assms by simp

theorem algebra_manipexpr_apbeq2cceqiacpbceqm2:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes "a + b = 2 * c" "c = \<i>"
  shows "a*c + b*c = -2"
proof -
  have "a + b = 2 * \<i>" using assms by simp
  then have "c * (a + b) = 2 * \<i> * c" by simp
  then have "a * c + b * c = -2" using assms by (smt (verit) distrib_right i_squared mult.left_commute mult_minus1_right)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem algebra_manipexpr_apbeq2cceqiacpbceqm2:

lemma algebra_sqineq_9s2b:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "(3 * sqrt 2 * a * b)^2 \<le> 9 * 2 * (a^2 + b^2)^2"
proof -

  also have "... \<le> 9 * 2 * (a^2 + b^2)^2" by (simp add: power2_sum power_mult_distrib)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

  fixes a b c:: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0"
  assumes "1 / a * abs(b + c) < 1"
  shows "abs(b + c) < a"
proof -
  have "abs(b + c) < a * 1" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma absolute_value_less_than_1:
  fixes a b c:: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0"
  assumes "1 / a * abs(b + c) < 1"
  shows "b + c < a"
proof -
  have "b + c < a * 1" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma binomial_squared:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "a^2 - b^2 = (a + b) * (a - b)"
proof -

  also have "... = (a + b) * (a - b)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)

theorem mathd_algebra_568:
  fixes a :: real
  shows "(a-1) * (a+1) * (a+2) - (a-2) * (a+1) = a^3 + a^2"
proof -
  have "(a-1) * (a+1) * (a+2) - (a-2) * (a+1) = (a^2 - 1) * (a+2) - (a^2 - a - 2)"
    by sos
  also have "... = a^3 + 2*a^2 - a - 2 - a^2 + a + 2"
    by sos
  also have "... = a^3 + a^2"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_480:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. x<0 \<Longrightarrow> f x = -(x^2)-1"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (0 \<le> x \<and> x < 4) \<Longrightarrow> f x = 2"
    and h2 : "\<And>x. x\<ge>4 \<Longrightarrow> f x = sqrt x"
  shows "f pi = 2"
proof -
  have c0:"pi \<ge> 0" by simp
  have c1:"0 \<le> pi" using c0 by simp
  have c2:"pi < 4" using pi_less_4 by auto
  have "f pi = 2" using h1[of pi] c1 c2 by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma difference_of_squares:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "(a - b) * (a + b) = a^2 - b^2"
  by sos

lemma distributive_property:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  shows "a * (b + c) = a * b + a * c"
  by (simp add: distrib_left)

lemma algebraic_identity:
  fixes a b :: complex
  shows "(a + a) * (a + b) = 2 * a^2 + 2 * (a * b)"
proof -
  have "(a + a) * (a + b) = a * (a + b) + a * (a + b)"
    by (simp add: distributive_property)
  also have "... = a * a + a * b + a * a + a * b"
    by (simp add: distributive_property)
  also have "... = a^2 + 2 * (a * b) + a^2"
    by (metis add.commute calculation combine_common_factor distributive_property group_cancel.add1 left_add_twice power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = 2 * a^2 + 2 * (a * b)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma am_gm:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x >= 0" "y >= 0"
  shows "x^2 + y^2 >= 2*x*y"
  using assms by (simp add: sum_squares_bound)

lemma am_gm_divide_form:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x > 0" "y > 0"
  shows "x/y + y/x >= 2"
proof -
  have c0:"sqrt(x/y) \<ge> 0"
    using assms by simp
  have c1:"sqrt(y/x) \<ge> 0"
    using assms by simp
  have "x/y + y/x >= 2 * sqrt(x/y) * sqrt(y/x)"
    using am_gm[of "sqrt(x/y)" "sqrt(y/x)"] c0 c1 by simp
   have "2 * sqrt(x/y) * sqrt(y/x) = 2 * sqrt(x/y * y/x)"
    by (metis ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) real_sqrt_mult times_divide_eq_right)
  then have "... = 2"
    using assms(1) assms(2) by fastforce
  show ?thesis
    using \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y * y / x) = 2\<close> \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y) * sqrt (y / x) = 2 * sqrt (x / y * y / x)\<close> \<open>2 * sqrt (x / y) * sqrt (y / x) \<le> x / y + y / x\<close> by presburger
qed

lemma am_gm_divide_form_generalized:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "a/b + b/a >= 2"
  using assms by (simp add: am_gm_divide_form)

theorem amc12b_2020_p5:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "(5::real) / 8 * b - 2 / 3 * a = 7"
    and "of_nat b - (5::real) / 8 * b - (a - 2 / 3 * a) = 7"
  shows "a = 42"
proof -
  have eq1: "15 * b = 16 * a + 168" using assms by auto
  have eq2: "9 * b = 8 * a + 168" using assms by auto
  have eq3: "6 * b = 8 * a" using eq1 eq2 by auto
  have eq4: "b = (4 / 3) * a" using assms eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "15 * ((4 / 3) * a) = 16 * a + 168" using eq1 eq4 by auto
  have eq6: "20 * a = 16 * a + 168" using eq5 by auto
  have eq7: "4 * a = 168" using eq6 by auto
  have eq8: "a = 42" using eq7 by auto
  show ?thesis using eq8 by simp
qed

  fixes a b n::nat

  shows "b=9"
proof -

  then have "9 = b" using assms by auto

qed

theorem algebra_2varlineareq_xpeeq7_2xpeeq3_eeq11_xeqn4:
  fixes x e :: complex
  assumes h0 : "x + e = 7"
    and h1 : "2 * x + e = 3"
  shows "e=11 \<and> x= (-4)"
proof -
  have "x + e - (2 * x + e) = 7 - 3" using assms(1,2) by simp
  then have "- x = 4" by simp
  then have "x = (-4)" by (metis verit_minus_simplify(4))
  then have "-4 + e = 7" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "e = 11" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>e = 11\<close> by (metis \<open>x = - 4\<close>)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_480:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. x<0 \<Longrightarrow> f x = -(x^2)-1"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (0 \<le> x \<and> x < 4) \<Longrightarrow> f x = 2"
    and h2 : "\<And>x. x\<ge>4 \<Longrightarrow> f x = sqrt x"
  shows "f pi = 2"
proof -
  have c0:"pi \<ge> 0" by simp
  have c1:"0 \<le> pi" using c0 by simp
  have c2:"pi < 4" using pi_less_4 by auto
  have "f pi = 2" using h1[of pi] c1 c2 by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_35:
  fixes p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. p x = 2 - x^2"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (x\<noteq>0) \<Longrightarrow> q x = 6 / x"
  shows "p (q 2) = -7"
proof -
  have "q 2 = 6 / 2" using h1 by auto
  then have "q 2 = 3" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = p 3" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 3^2" using h0 by auto
  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 9" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = -7" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma f_times:
  fixes f:: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x > 0. \<forall> y > 0. f (x * y) = f x / y"
    and "x > 0" "y > 0"
  shows "f (x * y) = f x / y"
proof -
  have "f (x * y) = f x / (x * y / x)" using assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) by auto
  also have "... = f x / y" using assms(2) assms(3) by auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

definition f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real \<Rightarrow> real" where
  "f x y = x - y * floor (x/y)"

lemma f_property:

  assumes "\<forall> x > 0. \<forall> y > 0. f (x * y) = f x / y"

  assumes "\<forall> x > 0. \<forall> y > 0. f (x * y) = f x / y"
    and "x > 0" "y > 0"

  using assms by auto

lemma f_times'':
  fixes f:: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes "\<forall> x > 0. \<forall> y > 0. f (x * y) = f x / y"
    and "x > 0" "y > 0" "z > 0"
  shows "f (x * y * z) = f x / (y * z)"
proof -
  have "f (x * y * z) = f (x * (y * z))" by (simp add: mult.assoc)
  also have "... = f x / (y * z)" using assms by auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma sum_of_odd_numbers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Sum> k < n+1. (2 * k - 1)) = n * n"
proof (induct n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then show ?case 
  proof -
    have "(\<Sum> k < Suc n + 1. (2 * k - 1)) = 2 * (Suc n) - 1 + (\<Sum> k < n + 1. (2 * k - 1))"
      by simp
    also have "... = 2 * (Suc n) - 1 + (n * n)"
      using Suc by simp
    also have "... = (n + 1) * (n + 1)"
      by simp
    finally show ?thesis by simp
  qed
qed

lemma sum_of_odd_numbers_2:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Sum> k \<in> {1..n}. (2 * k - 1)) = n * n"
proof -
  have "(\<Sum> k \<in> {1..n}. (2 * k - 1)) = (\<Sum> k < n+1. (2 * k - 1))"
    by (metis Suc_eq_plus1 add.commute add_0 atLeastLessThanSuc_atLeastAtMost lessThan_atLeast0 mult_2 one_add_one sum_of_odd_numbers sum_shift_lb_Suc0_0_upt zero_diff)
  also have "... = n * n"
    by (metis sum_of_odd_numbers)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_42:
  fixes u v :: nat
  assumes "27 * u mod 40 = 17"
    and "27 * v mod 40 = 17"
    and "u < 40"
    and "v < 80"
    and "40 < v" 
  shows "(u + v) = 62"
proof -
  have c0: "27 * u mod 40 = 17" using assms by auto
  have c1: "27 * v mod 40 = 17" using assms by auto

lemma sum_of_even_numbers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Sum> k < n+1. 2*k) = n*(n+1)"
proof (induct n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  assume IH: "(\<Sum> k < n + 1. 2 * k) = n * (n + 1)"
  have "(\<Sum> k < Suc n + 1. 2 * k) = (\<Sum> k < n + 1. 2 * k) + (2 * (n + 1))" by simp
  also have "... = (n * (n + 1)) + (2 * (n + 1))" using IH by simp
  also have "... = (n * (n + 1)) + (2 * n + 2)" by simp
  also have "... = (n * (n + 1) + 2 * n) + 2" by simp
  also have "... = ((n + 1) * (n + 2))" by (simp add: distrib_left)
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_42_a_general_solution:
  fixes a :: nat
  assumes "a mod 40 = 11"
  shows "\<exists>k. a = 40 * k + 11"
proof -
  have "a = 40 * (a div 40) + (a mod 40)" 
    by auto
  then have "a = 40 * (a div 40) + 11" 
    using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by blast
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_42_no_solution:
  fixes u v :: nat
  assumes "27 * u mod 40 = 17"
    and "27 * v mod 40 = 17" 
  shows "u = v"
proof -
  have "27 * u mod 40 = 27 * v mod 40" 
    using assms by simp
  then have "(27 * u - 27 * v) mod 40 = 0" 
    by linarith
  then have "27 * (u - v) mod 40 = 0" 
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "(u - v) mod 40 = 0" 
    by (simp add: assms(2) mod_mult_self1)
  then have "u mod 40 = v mod 40" 
    by simp
  then obtain k where "u = 40 * k + (v mod 40)"
    using mathd_numbertheory_42_a_general_solution by blast
  then have "u = 40 * k + v" 
    using assms(2) by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by presburger
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_42:
  fixes u v :: nat
  assumes "27 * u mod 40 = 17"
    and "27 * v mod 40 = 17"
    and "u < 40"
    and "v < 80"
    and "40 < v" 
  shows "(u + v) = 62"
proof -
  have c0: "u = v" using mathd_numbertheory_42_no_solution assms by simp
  have c1: "v = 51" 
    using assms(2) by auto
  have c2: "u = 11" 
    using c0 c1 by simp
  then show ?thesis 
    by simp
qed

lemma sum_of_odd_numbers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Sum> k \<in>{1..n}. 2 * k - 1) = n^2"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(\<Sum> k \<in>{1..Suc n}. 2 * k - 1) = (2 * (Suc n) - 1) + (\<Sum> k \<in>{1..n}. 2 * k - 1)"
    by simp
  also have "... = (2 * (Suc n) - 1) + n^2" 
    using Suc.IH by simp
  also have "... = (2 * n + 1) + n^2"
    by simp
  also have "... = n^2 + 2 * n + 1"
    by simp
  also have "... = (n + 1)^2"
    by (smt (verit) Suc_eq_plus1 add_Suc mult_2 nat_1_add_1 one_power2 plus_1_eq_Suc power2_sum)
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_109:
  fixes v :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
  assumes "\<forall> n. v n = 2 * n - 1" 
  shows "(\<Sum> k \<in>{1..<101}. v k) mod 7 = 4"
proof -
  have "(\<Sum> k \<in>{1..<101}. v k) = (\<Sum> k \<in>{1..<101}. 2 * k - 1)"
    using assms by simp
  also have "... = (100)^2"
    using sum_of_odd_numbers by eval
  finally have "(\<Sum> k \<in>{1..<101}. v k) = (100)^2" by simp
  have "(\<Sum> k \<in>{1..<101}. v k) mod 7 = (100)^2 mod 7"
    by (metis \<open>sum v {1..<101} = 100\<^sup>2\<close>)
  also have "... = 4"
    by (simp add: power_mod)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

  assumes "sqrt 131 = sqrt (169 - 8 * k)"
  shows "k = 19/4"
proof -
  have "131 = 169 - 8 * k"
    using assms by simp
  then have "8 * k = 169 - 131"
    by simp
  then have "8 * k = 38"
    by simp
  then have "k = 38 / 8"
    by simp
  then have "k = 19/4"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma fraction_product_calculation:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Prod>k::nat=1..n. ((4::real) * k + 4) / (4 * k)) = (4 * n + 4) / 4"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(\<Prod>k::nat=1..Suc n. ((4::real) * k + 4) / (4 * k)) = ((4 * Suc n + 4) / (4 * Suc n)) * (\<Prod>k::nat=1..n. ((4::real) * k + 4) / (4 * k))"
    by simp
  also have "... = ((4 * Suc n + 4) / (4 * Suc n)) * ((4 * n + 4) / 4)"
    using Suc.IH by presburger
  also have "... = ((4 * Suc n + 4) * (4 * n + 4)) / ((4 * Suc n) * 4)"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = ((4 * (Suc n + 1)) * (4 * (n + 1))) / ((4 * (Suc n)) * 4)"
    by simp
  also have "... = (4 * (Suc n + 1) * (n + 1)) / (4 * (Suc n))"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = (4 * (Suc n + 1) / 4) * ((n + 1) / (Suc n))"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  also have "... = (4 * (Suc n + 1) / 4)"
    by simp
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

lemma "(\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. ((4::real) * k + 4) / (4 * k)) = 502"
proof -
  have "(\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. ((4::real) * k + 4) / (4 * k)) = (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. (k + 1) / k)"
    by eval
  also have "... = (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. (k / k + 1 / k))"
    by eval
  also have "... = (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. 1 + 1 / k)"
    by simp
  also have "... = (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. k / k + 1 / k)"
    by simp
  also have "... = (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. k / k) * (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. 1 + 1 / k)"
    by (simp add: prod.distrib)
  also have "... = 1 * (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. 1 + 1 / k)"
    by simp
  also have "... = (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. 1 + 1 / k)"
    by simp
  also have "... = (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. (k + 1) / k)"
    by eval
  also have "... = (\<Prod>k::nat=1..501. ((4::real) * k + 4) / (4 * k))"
    by eval
  finally show ?thesis
    by eval
qed

lemma step3:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "0 < x \<and> 0 < y"
    and h1 : "y \<le> x"
    and h2 : "sqrt (x * y) * (x - y) = (x + y)"
  shows "sqrt (x * y) = (x + y) / (x - y)"
proof -

  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12a_2011_p18:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "abs (x+y) + abs (x-y) = 2"
  shows "x^2 - 6 * x + y^2 \<le> 8"
proof -
  have "(abs (x + y) + abs (x - y))^2 = 4" using assms by simp
  hence "(x + y)^2 + 2 * abs (x + y) * abs (x - y) + (x - y)^2 = 4" by sos
  hence "2 * x^2 + 2 * y^2 + 2 * abs (x + y) * abs (x - y) = 4" by sos
  hence "x^2 + y^2 + abs (x + y) * abs (x - y) = 2" by simp
  hence "x^2 - 6 * x + y^2 \<le> 8" by (smt (verit) diff_ge_0_iff_ge h0 less_eq_real_def mult_nonneg_nonneg real_sqrt_zero)
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma step3:

proof -

  hence "sqrt (x * y) = (x + y) / (x - y)" using h2 by (simp add: field_simps)
  thus "sqrt (x * y) = (x + y) / (x - y)" by simp
qed

lemma amc12a_2013_p8_helper_1:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x\<noteq>y"
  shows "x - y \<noteq> 0"

lemma amc12a_2013_p8_helper_2:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x\<noteq>0" "y\<noteq>0" "x\<noteq>y" "x + 2/x = y + 2/y"
  shows "x * y = 2"
proof -
  have eq1: "x^2 * y + 2 * y = x * y^2 + 2 * x" using assms by sos
  have eq2: "x^2 * y - x * y^2 = 2 * x - 2 * y" using eq1 by simp
  have eq3: "x * y * (x - y) = 2 * (x - y)" using eq2 by sos
  have "x - y \<noteq> 0" using amc12a_2013_p8_helper_1[OF assms(3)] .
  then have "x * y = 2" using eq3 by sos
  then show ?thesis .
qed

  then have "x * y = 2" using eq3 by sos
  then show ?thesis .
qed

theorem amc12a_2008_p2:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = 1"
  shows "x = 6/7"
proof -
  have "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (x * 1 / 2) + (x * 2 / 3)"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (x / 2) + (2 * x / 3)"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (3 * (x / 2) + 2 * x) / 3"
    by auto
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (3 * x / 2 + 2 * x) / 3"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (3 * x + 4 * x) / 6"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = 7 * x / 6"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = 1"
    using h0 by simp
  hence "7 * x = 6"
    by simp
  hence "x = 6 / 7"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis .
qed

lemma fraction_simplification:

  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_462:
  "((1::real)/2 + 1/3) * (1/2 - 1/3) = 5/36"
proof -
  have "((1::real)/2 + 1/3) * (1/2 - 1/3) = (1/2)^2 - (1/3)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  then have "((1::real)/2 + 1/3) * (1/2 - 1/3) = 1/4 - 1/9"
    by simp
  then have "((1::real)/2 + 1/3) * (1/2 - 1/3) = 5/36"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_190:
  "((3::real) / 8 + 7 / 8) / (4 / 5) = 25 / 16"
proof -

  then have "((3::real) / 8 + 7 / 8) / (4 / 5) = (10 / 8) / (4 / 5)" by simp
  also have "... = (10 / 8) * (5 / 4)" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (10 * 5) / (8 * 4)" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = 25 / 16" by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

  ultimately show ?thesis by auto

  then have "16 * x = 48" by simp

  then have "x = 3" by simp
  then show "x=3" .
qed

lemma logarithmic_equation_solving:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "a \<noteq> 1" "b \<noteq> 1"
  shows "(log a b = x) \<longleftrightarrow> (a^x = b)"
  by (smt (verit) assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) log_pow_cancel powr_log_cancel powr_realpow)

theorem amc12b_2020_p5:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "(5::real) / 8 * b - 2 / 3 * a = 7"
    and "of_nat b - (5::real) / 8 * b - (a - 2 / 3 * a) = 7"
  shows "a = 42"
proof -
  have eq1: "15 * b = 16 * a + 168" using assms by auto
  have eq2: "9 * b = 8 * a + 168" using assms by auto
  have eq3: "6 * b = 8 * a" using eq1 eq2 by auto
  have eq4: "b = (4 / 3) * a" using assms eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "15 * ((4 / 3) * a) = 16 * a + 168" using eq1 eq4 by auto
  have eq6: "20 * a = 16 * a + 168" using eq5 by auto
  have eq7: "4 * a = 168" using eq6 by auto
  have eq8: "a = 42" using eq7 by auto
  show ?thesis using eq8 by simp
qed

lemma solve_for_x:

  shows "x = 7 * ln 7 / (ln 8 - ln 7)"

lemma equation_solving:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes "a * x + b = c * x + d"
    and "a \<noteq> c"
  shows "x = (d - b) / (a - c)"
proof -
  have "(a - c) * x + (b - d) = 0" using assms(1) by sos
  then have "(x * (a - c)) + (b - d) = 0" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  then have "x * (a - c) = d - b" by simp
  then show ?thesis using assms(2) by (simp add: field_simps)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_89:
  fixes b :: real
  assumes h0 : "b\<noteq>0"
  shows "(7 * b^3)^2 * 1/((4 * b^2)^3) = 49 / 64"
proof -
  have c0: "(7 * b^3)^2 = 49 * b^6"
    by auto
  have c1: "1/((4 * b^2)^3) = 1/(4^3 * b^6)"
    by auto
  have c2: "1/(4^3 * b^6) = 1/(64 * b^6)"
    by auto
  from c0 c1 c2 have "(7 * b^3)^2 * 1/((4 * b^2)^3) = (49 * b^6) * (1/(64 * b^6))"
    by auto
  also have "... = 49 / 64" using assms by auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma mathd_algebra_89':
  fixes b :: real
  assumes "b\<noteq>0"
  shows "(7 * b^3)^2 / ((4 * b^2)^3) = 49 / 64"
proof -
  have "(7 * b^3)^2 / ((4 * b^2)^3) = (49 * b^6) / (64 * b^6)"
    by (simp add: power_divide)
  also have "... = 49 / 64" using assms by auto
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

proof -

    using assms by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12a_2021_p7:
  fixes x y ::real
  shows "1 \<le> ((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2"
proof -
  have "0 \<le> (x - y)^2" by simp
  hence "0 \<le> (x^2 - 2*x*y + y^2)" by sos
  hence "0 \<le> (x^2 + 2*x*y + y^2 - 4*x*y)" by simp
  hence "4*x*y \<le> (x+y)^2" by sos
  hence "(x*y - 1)^2 + (x+y)^2 \<ge> 1" by sos
  thus "1 \<le> ((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2" by simp
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_370:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = (3::nat)"
  shows "(2*n+1) mod 7 = (0::nat)"
proof -
  have "(2*n+1) mod 7 = (2*(n mod 7) + 1) mod 7" by (smt (verit) mod_add_cong mod_mult_right_eq)
  also have "... = (2*(3::nat) + 1) mod 7" using h0 by simp
  also have "... = (7::nat) mod 7" by simp
  finally have "(2*n+1) mod 7 = (7::nat) mod 7" by simp
  thus ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_370:

  also have "... = (2 * 3 + 1) mod 7" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = 7 mod 7" by simp
  also have "... = 0" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

qed

theorem mathd_algebra_247:
  fixes t s :: real
    and n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "t = 2 * s - s^2"
    and h1 : "s = n^2 - 2^n + 1"
    and h2 : "n=3"
  shows "t=0"
proof -
  have eq0: "s = 2" using h1 h2 by auto
  have "t = 2 * s - s^2" using h0 by auto
  hence "t = 2 * 2 - 2^2" using eq0 by auto
  hence "t = 4 - 4" by simp
  hence "t = 0" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12a_2021_p7:
  fixes x y ::real
  shows "1 \<le> ((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2"
proof -
  have "((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2 = x^2 * y^2 - 2 * x * y + 1 + x^2 + 2 * x * y + y^2" 
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (x^2 * y^2 + x^2 + y^2) + (1 - 2 * x * y + 2 * x * y)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (x^2 + 1) * (y^2 + 1)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... \<ge> 1" by sos
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_67:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 5 * x + 3"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. g x = x^2 - 2"
  shows "g (f (-1)) = 2"
proof -
  have "f (-1) = 5 * (-1) + 3" using h0 by auto
  then have "f (-1) = -5 + 3" by auto
  then have "f (-1) = -2" by auto
  have "g (f (-1)) = g (-2)" using h0 by auto
  then have "g (f (-1)) = (-2)^2 - 2" using h1 by auto
  then have "g (f (-1)) = 4 - 2" by auto
  then have "g (f (-1)) = 2" by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem amc12a_2008_p2:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = 1"
  shows "x = 6/7"
proof -
  have "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (x * 1 / 2) + (x * 2 / 3)"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (x / 2) + (2 * x / 3)"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (3 * (x / 2) + 2 * x) / 3"
    by auto
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (3 * x / 2 + 2 * x) / 3"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = (3 * x + 4 * x) / 6"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = 7 * x / 6"
    by (simp add: divide_simps)
  hence "x * (1 / 2 + 2 / 3) = 1"
    using h0 by simp
  hence "7 * x = 6"
    by simp
  hence "x = 6 / 7"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis .
qed

lemma amc12a_2013_p8_helper_2:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x\<noteq>0" "y\<noteq>0" "x\<noteq>y" "x + 2/x = y + 2/y"
  shows "x * y = 2"
proof -
  have eq1: "x^2 * y + 2 * y = x * y^2 + 2 * x" using assms by sos
  have eq2: "x^2 * y - x * y^2 = 2 * x - 2 * y" using eq1 by simp
  have eq3: "x * y * (x - y) = 2 * (x - y)" using eq2 by sos
  have "x - y \<noteq> 0" using amc12a_2013_p8_helper_1[OF assms(3)] .
  then have "x * y = 2" using eq3 by sos
  then show ?thesis .
qed

theorem amc12a_2017_p2:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> 0"
    and h1 : "y \<noteq> 0"
    and h2 : "x + y = 4 * (x * y)"
  shows "1/x + 1/y = 4"
proof -
  have "x + y - 4 * x * y = 0"
    using h2 by simp
  then have "x * (1 - 4 * y) + y * (1 - 4 * x) = 0"
    by arith
  then have "(1 - 4 * y) / x + (1 - 4 * x) / y = 0"
    using h0 h1 by (simp add: divide_simps)
  then have "(1 - 4 * y) / x + (1 - 4 * x) / y + 4 * x / y + 4 * y / x = 4 * x / y + 4 * y / x"
    by simp
  then have "(1 - 4 * y) * y + (1 - 4 * x) * x + 4 * x * y + 4 * y * x = 4 * x * y + 4 * y * x"
    using h0 h1 by (simp add: divide_simps)
  then have "(1 - 4 * y) * y / x + (1 - 4 * x) * x / y + 4 * x * y / x / y + 4 * y * x / y / x = 4"
    using h0 h1 by (simp add: divide_simps)
  then have "1 / x + 1 / y = 4"
    using h0 h1 by (simp add: divide_simps)
  then show ?thesis .
qed

theorem amc12a_2017_p2:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> 0"
    and h1 : "y \<noteq> 0"
    and h2 : "x + y = 4 * (x * y)"
  shows "1/x + 1/y = 4"
proof -
  have "1/x + 1/y = (y + x) / (x * y)" using h0 h1 by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (4 * (x * y)) / (x * y)" using h2 by (auto simp: field_simps)
  also have "... = ((1 - 4 * y) * x + y) / (x * y)" using h0 h1 by arith
  also have "... = (-y / (1 - 4 * y) + y) / (x * y)" using h0 h1 by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (-(1 - 3 * y) / (y * (1 - 4 * y)))" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (-1 + 3 * y) / (y * (1 - 4 * y))" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 4" using h1 by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

  have eq2: "x^2 * y - x * y^2 = 2 * x - 2 * y" using eq1 by simp
  have eq3: "x * y * (x - y) = 2 * (x - y)" using eq2 by sos
  have eq4: "x * y = 2" using eq3 amc12a_2013_p8_helper_1[OF h2] by sos
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma amc12a_2013_p8_simplified:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x \<noteq> 0"

lemma mathd_numbertheory_43_lemma:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "\<lfloor> real n / 5 \<rfloor> + \<lfloor> real n / 25 \<rfloor> + \<lfloor> real n / 125 \<rfloor> + \<lfloor> real n / 625 \<rfloor> = (\<Sum>k\<in>{1..4}. \<lfloor> real n / (5^k) \<rfloor>)"
proof -
  have "(\<Sum>k\<in>{1..4}. \<lfloor> real n / (5^k) \<rfloor>) = \<lfloor> real n / (5^1) \<rfloor> + \<lfloor> real n / (5^2) \<rfloor> + \<lfloor> real n / (5^3) \<rfloor> + \<lfloor> real n / (5^4) \<rfloor>"
    by (simp add: sum.atLeast_Suc_atMost)
  also have "... = \<lfloor> real n / 5 \<rfloor> + \<lfloor> real n / 25 \<rfloor> + \<lfloor> real n / 125 \<rfloor> + \<lfloor> real n / 625 \<rfloor>"
    by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma odd_minus_two:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "odd n" and "n > 1"
  shows "odd (n - 2)"
proof -
  have "odd (n - 2) \<or> even (n - 2)" by auto
  moreover have "\<not>even (n - 2)"
  proof (rule ccontr)
    assume "\<not>\<not>even (n - 2)"
    hence "even (n - 2)" by simp
    then obtain k where "n - 2 = 2 * k" by blast
    hence "n = 2 * k + 2" by (smt (verit) \<open>\<not> odd (n - 2)\<close> add_cancel_right_left assms(1) assms(2) dbl_simps(3) dbl_simps(5) dvd_minus_self even_plus_one_iff int_dvd_int_iff int_eq_iff_numeral int_ops(1) int_ops(2) int_ops(6) int_plus le_add2 less_add_same_cancel2 less_numeral_extra(3) mult_delta_right nat_1_add_1 nat_diff_split_asm nat_int_comparison(2) nat_less_le no_zero_divisors numerals(1) odd_one odd_one odd_pos of_nat_0_less_iff one_plus_numeral pos2 semiring_norm(2))
    hence "even n" by simp
    thus False using assms(1) by contradiction
  qed
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem amc12a_2021_p7:
  fixes x y ::real
  shows "1 \<le> ((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2"
proof -
  have "((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2 = (x^2 * y^2 - 2 * x * y + 1) + (x^2 + 2 * x * y + y^2)"
    by sos
  also have "... = x^2 * y^2 + x^2 + y^2 + 1"
    by (simp add: power2_sum power2_diff)
  also have "... = (x^2 + 1) * (y^2 + 1)"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  finally have "((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2 = (x^2 + 1) * (y^2 + 1)" .
  moreover have "(x^2 + 1) * (y^2 + 1) \<ge> 1" by sos
  ultimately show "1 \<le> ((x * y) - 1)^2 + (x + y)^2" by auto
qed

theorem amc12a_2021_p7:

  have eq2: "2 * ln x + ln y = 1" using assms(3) by (metis assms(4))
  have eq3: "ln y = 1/5" using eq1 eq2 by auto
  have eq4: "ln x = 2/5" using eq1 eq2 by auto
  show "ln x = 2/5" using eq4 by auto
  show "ln y = 1/5" using eq3 by auto

lemma algebra_2:
  fixes x y ::real

    and "ln x + 3 * ln y = 1"
    and "2 * ln x + ln y = 1"
  shows "ln x = 2/5" "ln y = 1/5"
proof -
  have "ln x + 3 * ln y = 2 * ln x + ln y" using assms(2) assms(3) by (metis assms(4))
  then have "ln x = 2/5" using assms(2) assms(3) by auto
  moreover have "ln y = 1/5" using assms(2) assms(3) by (smt (verit) add_divide_distrib assms(4) calculation)
  ultimately show "ln x = 2/5" "ln y = 1/5" by auto

lemma algebra_2:
  fixes x y ::real
  assumes "x>0" "y>0"
    and "ln x + 3 * ln y = 1"
    and "2 * ln x + ln y = 1"
  shows "ln x = 2/5" "ln y = 1/5"
proof -
  have eq1: "ln x + 3 * ln y = 1" by (simp add: assms)
  have eq2: "2 * ln x + ln y = 1" by (simp add: assms)
  have eq1': "ln x = 1 - 3 * ln y" using eq1 by simp
  have eq2': "ln y = 1 - 2 * ln x" using eq2 by simp
  have "ln x = 1 - 3 * (1 - 2 * ln x)" using eq1' eq2' by simp
  then have "ln x = 1 - 3 + 6 * ln x" by simp
  then have "ln x - 6 * ln x = -2" by simp
  then have "-5 * ln x = -2" by simp
  then have "ln x = 2/5" by simp
  have "ln y = 1 - 2 * (1 - 3 * ln y)" using eq1' eq2' by simp
  then have "ln y = 1 - 2 + 6 * ln y" by simp
  then have "ln y - 6 * ln y = -1" by simp
  then have "-5 * ln y = -1" by simp
  then have "ln y = 1/5" by simp
  then show "ln x = 2/5" "ln y = 1/5" using `ln x = 2/5` `ln y = 1/5` by simp_all
qed

theorem amc12a_2003_p1:
  fixes u v :: "nat \<Rightarrow> nat"
  assumes u:"\<forall>n. u n = 2 *n"
      and v:"\<forall>n. v n= 2* n -1"
    shows "(\<Sum> k \<in>{1..2003}. u k) - (\<Sum> k \<in>{1..2003}. v k) = 2003"
      (is "?L = ?R")
proof -
  define S_even where "S_even n = (\<Sum> k \<in>{0..n-1}. u k)" for n :: nat
  define S_odd where "S_odd n = (\<Sum> k \<in>{0..n-1}. v k)" for n :: nat

fun u :: "nat \<Rightarrow> real" where
  "u k = 2 * (sqrt 3) ^ k"

lemma u_ratio:
  fixes k :: nat
  shows "u (k+1) / u k = sqrt 3"
proof -
  have "u (k+1) / u k = (2 * (sqrt 3) ^ (k + 1)) / (2 * (sqrt 3) ^ k)"
    by simp
  also have "... = (sqrt 3) ^ (k+1) / (sqrt 3) ^ k"
    by (simp add: power_add)
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma geometric_sequence_ratio:
  fixes a r :: real
  assumes "r \<noteq> 0" and "a * r^3 = 6" and "a * r = 2"
  shows "r = sqrt 3 \<or> r = - sqrt 3"
proof -
  from assms(3) have "a \<noteq> 0" by auto
  then have "r^2 = 3" using assms(2) assms(3) by sos
  then have "r = sqrt 3 \<or> r = - sqrt 3" by (metis ab_semigroup_mult_class.mult_ac(1) dbl_inc_simps(3) mult.left_commute power2_eq_square real_sqrt_mult real_sqrt_pow2 real_sqrt_power square_eq_iff zero_le_square)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem amc12b_2020_p5:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "(5::real) / 8 * b - 2 / 3 * a = 7"
    and "of_nat b - (5::real) / 8 * b - (a - 2 / 3 * a) = 7"
  shows "a = 42"
proof -
  have eq1: "15 * b = 16 * a + 168" using assms by auto
  have eq2: "9 * b = 8 * a + 168" using assms by auto
  have eq3: "6 * b = 8 * a" using eq1 eq2 by auto
  have eq4: "b = (4 / 3) * a" using assms eq3 by auto
  have eq5: "15 * ((4 / 3) * a) = 16 * a + 168" using eq1 eq4 by auto
  have eq6: "20 * a = 16 * a + 168" using eq5 by auto
  have eq7: "4 * a = 168" using eq6 by auto
  have eq8: "a = 42" using eq7 by auto
  show ?thesis using eq8 by simp
qed

fun geometric_series :: "real \<Rightarrow> nat \<Rightarrow> real" where
  "geometric_series a 0 = 1" |
  "geometric_series a (Suc n) = a * geometric_series a n"

lemma power_inverse_geometric_series:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(1/a)^n = geometric_series (1/a) n"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  then have "(1/a)^(Suc n) = (1/a) * (1/a)^n" by simp
  also have "... = (1/a) * geometric_series (1/a) n" using Suc.IH by simp
  also have "... = geometric_series (1/a) (Suc n)" by simp
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

theorem algebra_manipexpr_apbeq2cceqiacpbceqm2:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes h0 : "a+b = 2*c"
    and h1 : "c = \<i>"
  shows "a*c+b*c=-2"
proof -
  have "(a+b)*c = 2*\<i>*c"
    using assms(1,2) by auto
  then have "a*c+b*c = 2*\<i>*c"
    by (simp add: field_simps)
  then have "a*c+b*c = -2"
    by (simp add: h1 power2_eq_square)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem algebra_manipexpr_apbeq2cceqiacpbceqm2:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes "a + b = 2 * c" "c = \<i>"
  shows "a * c + b * c = -2"
proof -
  have "a + b = 2 * \<i>" using assms by auto
  hence "(a + b) * c = (2 * \<i>) * c" by simp
  hence "a * c + b * c = 2 * \<i> * c" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  thus "a * c + b * c = -2" by (simp add: assms(2) power2_eq_square)
qed

theorem algebra_manipexpr_apbeq2cceqiacpbceqm2:

theorem amc12_2000_p5:
  fixes x p ::real
  assumes "x<2"
    and "\<bar>x -2\<bar> = p"
  shows "x - p = 2 - 2 * p"
proof -
  have c0: "\<bar>x - 2\<bar> = -(x - 2)"
    using assms(1) by simp
  have c1: "\<bar>x - 2\<bar> = p"
    using assms(2) by simp
  have "x = 2 - p"
    using c0 c1 by simp
  then have "x - p = (2 - p) - p" by simp
  then have "x - p = 2 - 2 * p" by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_119:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0 : "2 * a = 17 * b - 8"
    and h1 : "2 * b = a - 9"
  shows "b = (2 :: real)"
proof -
  have "a = 2 * b + 9" using h1 by simp
  then have "2 * (2 * b + 9) = 17 * b - 8" using h0 by simp
  then have "13 * b = 26" by simp
  then have "b = 2" by simp
  then have "a = 2 * 2 + 9" using h1 by simp
  then have "a = 13" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>b = 2\<close> by simp
qed

lemma fraction_simplification:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0" "b \<noteq> 0" "c \<noteq> 0" "d \<noteq> 0"
  shows "(a / b) / (c / d) = (a * d) / (b * c)"
proof -
  have "(a / b) / (c / d) = (a / b) * (d / c)" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (a * d) / (b * c)" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes h0 : "a * x + b = c"
    and h1 : "a \<noteq> 0"

proof -

  then have "x = (c - b)/a"

qed

lemma induction_divisibility_3div2tooddnp1:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(3::nat) dvd (2^(2 * n + 1) + 1)"
proof (induction n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  have "(2::nat)^(2 * (Suc n) + 1) + 1 = (2::nat)^((2 * n + 1) + 2) + 1"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = (2::nat)^(2 * n + 1) * (2::nat)^2 + 1"
    by (simp add: power_add)
  also have "... = (2::nat)^(2 * n + 1) * 4 + 1"
    by simp
  also have "... = 4 * ((2::nat)^(2 * n + 1)) + 1"
    by (simp add: mult.commute)
  also have "... = 3 * ((2::nat)^(2 * n + 1)) + ((2::nat)^(2 * n + 1) + 1)"
    by simp
  finally have "(2::nat)^(2 * (Suc n) + 1) + 1 = 3 * ((2::nat)^(2 * n + 1)) + ((2::nat)^(2 * n + 1) + 1)"
    by simp
  moreover have "3 dvd 3 * ((2::nat)^(2 * n + 1))"
    by simp
  moreover have "3 dvd ((2::nat)^(2 * n + 1) + 1)"
    using Suc.IH by auto
  ultimately have "3 dvd (2::nat)^(2 * (Suc n) + 1) + 1"
    by (metis dvd_add)
  then show ?case by simp
qed

lemma induction_divisibility_induction_hypothesis:
  fixes k::nat
  assumes "3 dvd k^3 + 2*k"
  shows "3 dvd (k+1)^3 + 2*(k+1)"
proof -
  have "(k+1)^3 + 2*(k+1) = k^3 + 3*k^2 + 3*k + 1 + 2*k + 2"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square power3_eq_cube)
  also have "... = (k^3 + 2*k) + 3*k^2 + 3*k + 3"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally have "(k+1)^3 + 2*(k+1) = (k^3 + 2*k) + 3*k^2 + 3*k + 3"
    by simp
  moreover have "3 dvd 3*k^2 + 3*k + 3"
    by simp
  ultimately have "3 dvd (k+1)^3 + 2*(k+1)"
    using assms by presburger
  then show ?thesis
    using assms by simp
qed

lemma sum_of_odd_numbers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(\<Sum> k < n+1. 2*k - 1) = n*n"
proof (induct n)
  case 0
  then show ?case by simp
next
  case (Suc n)
  assume IH: "(\<Sum> k < n + 1. 2 * k - 1) = n * n"
  have "(\<Sum> k < Suc n + 1. 2 * k - 1) = (\<Sum> k < n + 1. 2 * k - 1) + (2 * (n + 1) - 1)" by simp
  also have "... = (n * n) + (2 * (n + 1) - 1)" using IH by simp
  also have "... = (n * n) + (2 * n + 2 - 1)" by simp
  also have "... = (n * n) + (2 * n + 1)" by simp
  also have "... = ((n + 1) * (n + 1))" by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  finally show ?case by simp
qed

  also have "... = (n * (n + 1)) + (2 * (n + 1))" using IH by simp

theorem mathd_algebra_110:

  assumes "q = 2 - 2 * \<i>" "e = 5 + 5 * \<i>"
  shows "q * e = 20"
proof -
  have "q * e = (2 - 2 * \<i>) * (5 + 5 * \<i>)" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 20" by eval
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_462:
  "((1::real)/2 + 1/3) * (1/2 - 1/3) = 5/36"
proof -
  have "((1::real)/2 + 1/3) * (1/2 - 1/3) = (1/2)^2 - (1/3)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  then have "((1::real)/2 + 1/3) * (1/2 - 1/3) = 1/4 - 1/9"
    by simp
  then have "((1::real)/2 + 1/3) * (1/2 - 1/3) = 5/36"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma abs_less_iff:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "abs(a) < b \<longleftrightarrow> -b < a \<and> a < b"
by auto

theorem mathd_algebra_327:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes h0 : "1 / 5 * abs(9 + 2 * a) < 1"
  shows "-7 < a \<and> a < -2"
proof -
  have "abs(9 + 2 * a) < 5" using assms by simp
  then have "-5 < 9 + 2 * a \<and> 9 + 2 * a < 5"
    using abs_less_iff by blast
  then have "-7 < a \<and> a < -2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_327:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes h0 : "1 / 5 * abs(9 + 2 * a) < 1"
  shows "-7 < a \<and> a < -2"
proof -
  have "abs(9 + 2 * a) < 5" using assms by simp
  moreover {
    assume "9 + 2 * a < 5"
    then have "a < -2" by simp
  }
  moreover {
    assume "-(9 + 2 * a) < 5"
    then have "a > -7" by simp
  }
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_327:
  fixes a :: real
  assumes h0 : "1 / 5 * abs(9 + 2 * a) < 1"
  shows "-7 < a \<and> a < -2"
proof -
  have "abs(9 + 2 * a) < 5" using assms by simp
  hence "-5 < 9 + 2 * a \<and> 9 + 2 * a < 5" by auto
  hence "-14 < 2 * a \<and> 2 * a < -4" by auto
  hence "-7 < a \<and> a < -2" by simp
  thus ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem absolute_value_inequality:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes h0: "abs(a - b) < c"
  shows "b - c < a \<and> a < b + c"
proof -
  have "a - b < c" and "-(a - b) < c" using assms by auto
  moreover {
    assume "a - b < c"
    then have "b - c < a" by (metis abs_diff_less_iff h0)
  }
  moreover {
    assume "-(a - b) < c"
    then have "a < b + c" by (metis abs_diff_less_iff h0)
  }
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_126:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "2 * 3 = x - 9"
    and h1 : "2 * (-5) = y + 1"
  shows "x=15 \<and> y = -11"
proof -
  have eq1: "6 = x - 9" using assms by auto
  have eq2: "-10 = y + 1" using assms by auto
  have eq3: "x = 15" using eq1 by auto
  have eq4: "y = -11" using eq2 by auto
  then show ?thesis using eq3 eq4 by auto
qed

lemma square_inequality:
  fixes a b :: real
  shows "(a+1)^2 - 4*b*(a+1) + 4*b^2 \<ge> 0"
proof -
  have "(a+1 - 2*b)^2 \<ge> 0"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis
    by sos
qed

lemma quad_eq_roots_sum:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
    and "\<Delta> = b^2 - 4*a*c"
    and "r1 = (-b + sqrt \<Delta>) / (2*a)"
    and "r2 = (-b - sqrt \<Delta>) / (2*a)"
  shows "r1 + r2 = - (b/a)"
  by (simp add: assms(1) assms(3) assms(4) field_simps)

lemma cancle_div:
  fixes x a b c:: real
  assumes "x > 0" "a + b / x = c"
  shows "a * x + b = c * x"
proof -
  have "x * (a + b / x) = c * x"
    using assms(2) by auto
  then have "x * a + x * (b / x) = c * x"
    by (simp add: distrib_left)
  then show ?thesis
    using assms(1) by (simp add: mult.commute)
qed

  fixes a b c d :: complex
  shows "(a + b) * (c + d) = a * c + a * d + b * c + b * d"

theorem mathd_algebra_37:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=7"
    and h1 : "3 * x + y = 45"
  shows "x^2 - y^2 = 217"
proof -
  have "x^2 - y^2 = (x+y) * (x-y)" by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = 7 * (x-y)" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = 7 * (x - (45 - 3 * x))" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = 7 * (4 * x - 45)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 28 * x - 315" by simp
  finally have "x^2 - y^2 = 28 * x - 315" .
  moreover have "x = 19" using assms by simp
  ultimately have "x^2 - y^2 = 217" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_37:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=7"
    and h1 : "3 * x + y = 45"
  shows "x^2 - y^2 = 217"
proof -
  have eq0: "x = 19" using assms by auto
  have eq1: "y = -12" using assms eq0 by auto
  have "x^2 - y^2 = 19^2 - (-12)^2" using eq0 eq1 by simp
  then have "x^2 - y^2 = 217" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_480:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. x<0 \<Longrightarrow> f x = -(x^2)-1"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (0 \<le> x \<and> x < 4) \<Longrightarrow> f x = 2"
    and h2 : "\<And>x. x\<ge>4 \<Longrightarrow> f x = sqrt x"
  shows "f pi = 2"
proof -
  have c0:"pi \<ge> 0" by simp
  have c1:"0 \<le> pi" using c0 by simp
  have c2:"pi < 4" using pi_less_4 by auto
  have "f pi = 2" using h1[of pi] c1 c2 by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_480':
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. x<0 \<Longrightarrow> f x = -(x^2)-1"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (0 \<le> x \<and> x < 4) \<Longrightarrow> f x = 2"
    and h2 : "\<And>x. x\<ge>4 \<Longrightarrow> f x = sqrt x"
  shows "f pi = 2"
proof -
  have "f pi = 2" using h1[of pi] by (simp add: pi_ge_zero pi_less_4)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem solve_for_x_and_y:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "a * b = x - c"
    and h1 : "a * d = y + e"
  shows "x = a * b + c \<and> y = a * d - e"
proof -
  have eq1: "a * b = x - c" using assms by auto
  have eq2: "a * d = y + e" using assms by auto
  have eq3: "x = a * b + c" using eq1 by auto
  have eq4: "y = a * d - e" using eq2 by auto
  then show ?thesis using eq3 eq4 by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_252:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0: "x \<noteq> 0"
    and h1: "3 + 1/x = 7/x"
  shows "x = 2"
proof -
  have "3 + 1/x - 7/x = 0" using assms(2) by simp
  hence "(3 * x + 1 - 7) / x = 0" by (auto simp: field_simps)
  hence "(3 * x - 6) / x = 0" by simp
  hence "3 * x - 6 = 0" using assms(1) by simp
  hence "x = 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_190:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0" "d \<noteq> 0"
  shows "((a / b) + (c / d)) / (4 / 5) = ((a * d + b * c) / (b * d)) * (5 / 4)"
proof -
  have "((a / b) + (c / d)) = ((a * d + b * c) / (b * d))" using assms by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "((a / b) + (c / d)) / (4 / 5) = ((a * d + b * c) / (b * d)) / (4 / 5)" by simp
  also have "... = ((a * d + b * c) / (b * d)) * (5 / 4)" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_119:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0 : "2 * a = 17 * b - 8"
    and h1 : "2 * b = a - 9"
  shows "b = (2 :: real)"
proof -
  have "a = 2 * b + 9" using h1 by simp
  then have "2 * (2 * b + 9) = 17 * b - 8" using h0 by simp
  then have "13 * b = 26" by simp
  then have "b = 2" by simp
  then have "a = 2 * 2 + 9" using h1 by simp
  then have "a = 13" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>b = 2\<close> by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_43:
  fixes a b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = a * x + b"
    and h1 : "f 7 = 4"
    and h2 : "f 6 = 3"
  shows "f 3 = 0"
proof -
  have c0: "a = (3 - 4) / (6 - 7)"
    using h0 h1 h2 by auto
  have c1: "b = f 7 - a * 7"
    using h0 h1 by auto
  have c2: "f x = a * x + b"
    using h0 by auto
  have "f 3 = a * 3 + b" using c2 by (metis h0)
  then have "f 3 = 0" using c0 c1 by (smt (verit) h1 one_le_power one_power2 right_inverse_eq)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_421:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes h0 : "b = a^2 + 4 * a + 6"
    and h1 : "b = 1 / 2 * a^2 + a + 6"
    and h2 : "d = c^2 + 4 * c + 6"
    and h3 : "d = 1 / 2 * c^2 + c + 6"
    and h4 : "a < c"
  shows "c-a=6"
proof -
  have c0: "c - a = 6"
    using assms by sos
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_190:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "b \<noteq> 0" "c \<noteq> 0"
  shows "((a::real) / b + c / b) / (4 / 5) = (5 * a + 5 * c) / (4 * b)"
proof -
  have "((a::real) / b + c / b) = (a + c) / b" by (simp add: add_divide_distrib)
  then have "((a::real) / b + c / b) / (4 / 5) = ((a + c) / b) / (4 / 5)" by simp
  also have "... = ((a + c) / b) * (5 / 4)" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = ((a + c) * 5) / (b * 4)" by (simp add: divide_simps)
  also have "... = (5 * a + 5 * c) / (4 * b)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_35:
  fixes p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. p x = 2 - x^2"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (x\<noteq>0) \<Longrightarrow> q x = 6 / x"
  shows "p (q 2) = -7"
proof -
  have "q 2 = 6 / 2" using h1 by auto
  then have "q 2 = 3" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = p 3" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 3^2" using h0 by auto
  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 9" by simp
  then have "p (q 2) = -7" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_616:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = x^3 + 2 * x + 1"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. g x = x - 1"
  shows "f (g 1) = 1"
proof -
  have "f (g 1) = (g 1)^3 + 2 * (g 1) + 1" using h0 by simp
  hence "f (g 1) = 0^3 + 2 * 0 + 1" using h1 by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_119:
  fixes d e :: real
  assumes h0 : "2 * d = 17 * e - 8"
    and h1 : "2 * e = d - 9"
  shows "e = 2"
proof -
  have "d = 2 * e + 9" using h1 by simp
  then have "2 * (2 * e + 9) = 17 * e - 8" using h0 by simp
  then have "4 * e + 18 = 17 * e - 8" by simp
  then have "18 + 8 = 17 * e - 4 * e" by simp
  then have "26 = 13 * e" by simp
  then have "e = 26 / 13" by simp
  then have "e = 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem algebra_2varlineareq_xpeeq7_2xpeeq3_eeq11_xeqn4:
  fixes x e :: complex
  assumes h0 : "x + e = 7"
    and h1 : "2 * x + e = 3"
  shows "e=11 \<and> x= (-4)"
proof -
  have "- x = 4" using assms(1,2) by (metis ab_group_add_class.ab_diff_conv_add_uminus ab_semigroup_add_class.add_ac(1) add.commute add.inverse_distrib_swap add_neg_numeral_simps(2) diff_eq_eq diff_numeral_simps(1) left_add_twice minus_diff_eq numeral_Bit0 numeral_Bit1 numeral_One numeral_eq_iff numeral_plus_numeral semiring_norm(166) semiring_norm(4) uminus_add_conv_diff verit_minus_simplify(4))
  then have "x = (-4)" by (metis verit_minus_simplify(4))
  then have "e = 7 - (-4)" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "e = 11" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>e = 11\<close> by (metis \<open>x = - 4\<close>)
qed

theorem algebra_2varlineareq_xpeeq7_2xpeeq3_eeq11_xeqn4:
  fixes x e :: complex
  assumes h0 : "x + e = 7"
    and h1 : "2 * x + e = 3"
  shows "e=11 \<and> x= (-4)"
proof -
  have "x + e - (2 * x + e) = 7 - 3" using assms(1,2) by simp
  then have "- x = 4" by simp
  then have "x = (-4)" by (metis verit_minus_simplify(4))
  then have "-4 + e = 7" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "e = 11" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>e = 11\<close> by (metis \<open>x = - 4\<close>)
qed

lemma quadratic_equation_real_solutions:
  fixes a b c x :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0"
    and "b^2 - 4*a*c \<ge> 0"
  shows "a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x = (-b + sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a) \<or> x = (-b - sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a)"
proof -
  have "a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> 4*a^2*x^2 + 4*a*b*x + 4*a*c = 0"
    using assms(1) by sos
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> (2*a*x + b)^2 = b^2 - 4*a*c"
    by sos
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> 2*a*x + b = sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c) \<or> 2*a*x + b = - sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c)"
    using assms(2) by (smt (verit) power2_eq_iff real_sqrt_pow2)
  also have "... \<longleftrightarrow> x = (-b + sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a) \<or> x = (-b - sqrt(b^2 - 4*a*c))/(2*a)"
    using assms(1) by (auto simp: field_simps)
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_433:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * sqrt (2 * x -7) - 8"
  shows "f 8 = 1"
proof -
  have "f 8 = 3 * sqrt (2 * 8 - 7) - 8" using h0 by auto
  also have "... = 3 * sqrt (16 - 7) - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 3 * sqrt 9 - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 3 * 3 - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 1" by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

lemma quadratic_formula_real_roots:
  fixes a b c x :: real
  assumes "a \<noteq> 0" "b^2 - 4*a*c \<ge> 0"
  shows "a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x = (-b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a) \<or> x = (-b - sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)"
proof -
  have "a*x^2 + b*x + c = a * (x - (-b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)) * (x - (-b - sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a))"
    using assms by sos
  moreover have "a * (x - (-b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)) * (x - (-b - sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)) = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x = (-b + sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a) \<or> x = (-b - sqrt (b^2 - 4*a*c)) / (2*a)"
    using assms by auto
  ultimately show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_433:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * sqrt (2 * x -7) - 8"
  shows "f 8 = 1"
proof -

  also have "... = 3 * sqrt 9 - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 3 * 3 - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 9 - 8" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes k :: real
  assumes "sqrt 131 = sqrt (169 - 8 * k)"
  shows "k = 19/4"
proof -
  have "131 = 169 - 8 * k"
    using assms by simp
  then have "8 * k = 169 - 131"
    by simp
  then have "8 * k = 38"
    by simp
  then have "k = 38 / 8"
    by simp
  then have "k = 19/4"
    by simp
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem algebra_manipexpr_2erprsqpesqeqnrpnesq:
  fixes e r :: complex
  shows "2 * (e * r) + (e^2 + r^2) = (-r + (-e))^2"
proof -
  have "2 * (e * r) + (e^2 + r^2) = e^2 + 2 * (e * r) + r^2"
    by (simp add: add.commute)
  also have "... = (-r)^2 + 2 * (-r) * (-e) + (-e)^2"
    by (simp add: power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = r^2 + 2 * (e * r) + e^2"
    by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  finally show ?thesis by (smt (verit) \<open>(- r)\<^sup>2 + 2 * - r * - e + (- e)\<^sup>2 = r\<^sup>2 + 2 * (e * r) + e\<^sup>2\<close> add.commute add_diff_cancel_left' minus_mult_minus mult.assoc mult.commute power2_eq_iff power2_sum)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_247:

  hence "t = 2 * 2 - 2^2" using eq0 by auto

  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

qed

theorem algebra_2varlineareq_xpeeq7_2xpeeq3_eeq11_xeqn4:
  fixes x e :: complex
  assumes h0 : "x + e = 7"
    and h1 : "2 * x + e = 3"
  shows "e=11 \<and> x= (-4)"
proof -
  have "x + e - (2 * x + e) = 7 - 3" using assms(1,2) by simp
  then have "- x = 4" by simp
  then have "x = (-4)" by (metis verit_minus_simplify(4))
  then have "-4 + e = 7" using assms(1) by simp
  then have "e = 11" by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>e = 11\<close> by (metis \<open>x = - 4\<close>)
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_327:

  assumes h0 : "1 / 5 * abs(9 + 2 * a) < 1"

proof -

  hence "-5 < 9 + 2 * a \<and> 9 + 2 * a < 5" by auto
  hence "-5 - 9 < 2 * a \<and> 2 * a < 5 - 9" by simp
  hence "-14 / 2 < a \<and> a < -4 / 2" by simp
  thus "-7 < a \<and> a < -2" by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_327:

  moreover {

  moreover {

lemma mathd_numbertheory_45_lemma2:

lemma algebraic_manipulation:
  fixes a b c d :: real
  assumes "a powr b + c powr d = x"

  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem algebra_add_eq_mult_plus_one:

proof -

  then have "q 2 = 3" by simp

  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 3^2" using h0 by auto
  then have "p (q 2) = 2 - 9" by simp

  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_547:

proof -
  have "x^3 - y^2 = 5^3 - 2^2" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 125 - 4" by simp
  also have "... = 121" by simp
  finally have "x^3 - y^2 = 121" by simp
  then show ?thesis using real_sqrt_unique[of "x^3 - y^2" 11] by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_37:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=7"
    and h1 : "3 * x + y = 45"
  shows "x^2 - y^2 = 217"
proof -
  have "x^2 - y^2 = (x+y) * (x-y)" by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = 7 * (x-y)" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = 7 * (x - (45 - 3 * x))" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = 7 * (4 * x - 45)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 28 * x - 315" by simp
  finally have "x^2 - y^2 = 28 * x - 315" .
  moreover have "x = 19" using assms by simp
  ultimately have "x^2 - y^2 = 217" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_493:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = x^2 - 4 * (sqrt x) + 1"
  shows "\<forall> x. f (f x) = (x^2 - 4 * (sqrt x) + 1)^2 - 4 * (sqrt (x^2 - 4 * (sqrt x) + 1)) + 1"
proof -
  have eq0: "f x = x^2 - 4 * (sqrt x) + 1" using h0 by auto
  have "f (f x) = f (x^2 - 4 * (sqrt x) + 1)" using eq0 by auto
  also have "... = (x^2 - 4 * (sqrt x) + 1)^2 - 4 * (sqrt (x^2 - 4 * (sqrt x) + 1)) + 1" using eq0 by (metis diff_minus_eq_add h0 verit_minus_simplify(3))

theorem mathd_algebra_67:
  fixes f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 5 * x + 3"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. g x = x^2 - 2"
  shows "g (f (-1)) = 2"
proof -
  have "f (-1) = 5 * (-1) + 3" using h0 by auto
  then have "f (-1) = -5 + 3" by auto
  then have "f (-1) = -2" by auto
  have "g (f (-1)) = g (-2)" using h0 by auto
  then have "g (f (-1)) = (-2)^2 - 2" using h1 by auto
  then have "g (f (-1)) = 4 - 2" by auto
  then have "g (f (-1)) = 2" by auto
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

lemma log_to_power:
  fixes a b :: real
  assumes h0: "a > 0" and h1: "a \<noteq> 1" and h2: "b > 0" and h3: "log a b = c"
  shows "b = a powr c"
by (metis assms(1) assms(2) assms(3) assms(4) powr_log_cancel powr_realpow)

lemma log_value:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes h0: "a > 0" and h1: "a \<noteq> 1" and h2: "b > 0" and h3: "log a b = c"
  shows "b = a powr c"
proof -
  have "log a b = log a (a powr c)" using assms by simp
  then have "log a b = c * log a a" using assms by (simp add: log_nat_power)
  then have "log a b = c" using assms by simp
  then show ?thesis using assms by auto
qed

lemma mod_add_power:
  fixes x n a b c :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "b > 0" "c > 0" "x mod n = a"
  shows "((x + b)^c) mod n = ((a + b)^c) mod n"
proof -
  have "(x + b)^c mod n = ((x mod n) + b)^c mod n"
    by (smt (verit) mod_add_left_eq power_mod)
  also have "... = (a + b)^c mod n"
    using assms(4) by auto
  finally show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem algebra_manipexpr_apbeq2cceqiacpbceqm2:
  fixes a b c :: complex
  assumes h0 : "a+b = 2*c"
    and h1 : "c = \<i>"
  shows "a*c+b*c=-2"
proof -

    using assms(1,2) by auto
  then have "(a+b)*c = (2*\<i>) * c"
    by (simp add: h1)
  then have "a*c+b*c = 2*\<i>*c"
    by (auto simp: field_simps)
  then have "a*c+b*c = -2"
    by (simp add: h1 power2_eq_square)
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_96:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0: "n mod 4 = 2"
  shows "(n+1) mod 4 = 3"

    have "n mod 4 \<noteq> 0" using h0 by auto
    then have "n mod 4 = 2 \<or> n mod 4 = 3" using assms by auto
    then have "(n+1) mod 4 = (2+1) mod 4 \<or> (n+1) mod 4 = (3+1) mod 4" by presburger
    then show ?thesis by (metis Suc_eq_plus1_left add.commute cong_exp_iff_simps(2) cong_exp_iff_simps(3) eval_nat_numeral(3) h0 mod_Suc mod_self)
  qed
  then show ?thesis using h0 by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_159:
  fixes b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * x^4 - 7 * x^3 + 2*x^2 - b*x +1"
    and h1 : "f 1 = 1"
  shows "b = -2"
proof -
  have f_def: "\<And>x. f x = 3*x^4 - 7*x^3 + 2*x^2 - b*x +1" using h0 by simp
  have "f 1 = 3*1^4 - 7*1^3 + 2*1^2 - b*1 + 1" using f_def by simp
  hence "f 1 = 3 - 7 + 2 - b + 1" by simp
  hence "f 1 = -b - 1" by simp
  hence "f 1 = 1" using h1 by simp
  have "-b - 1 = 1" using `f 1 = 1` by (metis \<open>f 1 = - b - 1\<close>)
  hence "-b = 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_159_generalized:
  fixes b :: real
    and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
    and n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * x^n - 7 * x^(n-1) + 2*x^(n-2) - b*x +1"
    and h1 : "f 1 = 1"
  shows "b = -2"
proof -
  have f_def: "\<And>x. f x = 3*x^n - 7*x^(n-1) + 2*x^(n-2) - b*x +1" using h0 by simp
  have "f 1 = 3*1^n - 7*1^(n-1) + 2*1^(n-2) - b*1 + 1" using f_def by simp
  hence "f 1 = 3 - 7 + 2 - b + 1" by simp
  hence "f 1 = -b - 1" by simp
  hence "f 1 = 1" using h1 by simp
  have "-b - 1 = 1" using `f 1 = 1` by (metis \<open>f 1 = - b - 1\<close>)
  hence "-b = 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_335:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = 5"
  shows "(5 * n) mod 7 = 4"
proof -
  obtain k where c0: "n = 7*k + 5" using assms(1) by (metis div_mod_decomp mult.commute)
  have "(5 * n) = 5 * (7 * k + 5)" using c0 by auto
  then have "(5 * n) = 35 * k + 25" by auto
  then have "(5 * n) mod 7 = 4" by presburger
  then show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_numbertheory_458:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 8 = (7::nat)"
  shows "n mod 4 = 3"
proof -
  obtain k where c0: "n = 8 * k + 7" using h0 div_mult_mod_eq by (metis mod_div_decomp mult.commute)
  have "(n mod 4) = ((8 * k + 7) mod 4)" using c0 by auto
  also have "... = (7 mod 4)" by presburger
  also have "... = 3" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_247:
  fixes t s :: real
    and n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "t = 2 * s - s^2"
    and h1 : "s = n^2 - 2^n + 1"
    and h2 : "n=3"
  shows "t=0"
proof -
  have eq0: "s = 2" using h1 h2 by auto
  have eq1: "t = 2 * s - s^2" using h0 by auto
  have "t = 2 * 2 - 2^2" using eq0 eq1 by auto
  hence "t = 4 - 4" by simp
  hence "t = 0" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

lemma mathd_numbertheory_370:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes h0 : "n mod 7 = (3::nat)"
  shows "(2*n+1) mod 7 = (0::nat)"
proof -
  have "(2 * n + 1) mod 7 = (2 * (n mod 7) + 1) mod 7" by (smt (verit) mod_add_cong mod_mult_right_eq)
  also have "... = (2 * 3 + 1) mod 7" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = 7 mod 7" by simp
  also have "... = 0" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_37:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=7"
    and h1 : "3 * x + y = 45"
  shows "x^2 - y^2 = 217"
proof -
  have eq0: "x = 19" using assms by auto
  have eq1: "y = -12" using assms eq0 by auto
  have "x^2 - y^2 = 19^2 - (-12)^2" using eq0 eq1 by simp
  then have "x^2 - y^2 = 217" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_126:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "2 * 3 = x - 9"
    and h1 : "2 * (-5) = y + 1"
  shows "x=15 \<and> y = -11"
proof -
  have "6 = x - 9" using h0 by auto
  then have "x = 15" by auto
  moreover have "-10 = y + 1" using h1 by auto
  then have "y = -11" by auto
  ultimately show ?thesis by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_251:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0: "x \<noteq> 0"
    and h1: "3 + 1/x = 7/x"
  shows "x = 2"
proof -
  have "3 * x + 1 = 7" using assms(1) assms(2) by (auto simp: field_simps)
  hence "3 * x = 6" by simp
  hence "x = 2" by simp
  then show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_251_multi_dimension:
  fixes x :: real
  fixes y :: real
  assumes h0: "x \<noteq> 0"
    and h1: "3 + 1/x = 7/x"
    and h2: "y = 2 * x"
  shows "x = 2 \<and> y = 4"
proof -
  have "3 * x + 1 = 7" using assms(1) assms(2) by (auto simp: field_simps)
  hence "3 * x = 6" by simp
  hence "x = 2" by simp
  then have "y = 4" using assms(3) by simp
  then show ?thesis using \<open>x = 2\<close> by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_547:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes "x = 5"
    and "y = 2"
  shows "sqrt (x^3 - y^2) = 11"
proof -
  have "x^3 - y^2 = 5^3 - 2^2" using assms by simp
  also have "... = 125 - 4" by simp
  also have "... = 121" by simp
  finally have "x^3 - y^2 = 121" by simp
  then show ?thesis using real_sqrt_unique[of "x^3 - y^2" 11] by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_126:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "2 * 3 = x - 9"
    and h1 : "2 * (-5) = y + 1"
  shows "x=15 \<and> y = -11"
proof -
  have eq1: "6 = x - 9" using assms by auto
  have eq2: "-10 = y + 1" using assms by auto
  have eq3: "x = 15" using eq1 by auto
  have eq4: "y = -11" using eq2 by auto
  then show ?thesis using eq3 eq4 by auto
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_37:
  fixes x y :: real
  assumes h0 : "x+y=7"
    and h1 : "3 * x + y = 45"
  shows "x^2 - y^2 = 217"
proof -
  have "x^2 - y^2 = (x+y) * (x-y)" by (simp add: algebra_simps power2_eq_square)
  also have "... = 7 * (x-y)" using assms(1) by simp
  also have "... = 7 * (x - (45 - 3 * x))" using assms(2) by simp
  also have "... = 7 * (4 * x - 45)" by (simp add: algebra_simps)
  also have "... = 28 * x - 315" by simp
  finally have "x^2 - y^2 = 28 * x - 315" .
  moreover have "x = 19" using assms by simp
  ultimately have "x^2 - y^2 = 217" by simp
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_433:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * sqrt (2 * x -7) - 8"
  shows "f 8 = 1"
proof -
  have "f 8 = 3 * sqrt (2 * 8 - 7) - 8" using h0 by auto
  also have "... = 3 * sqrt (16 - 7) - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 3 * sqrt 9 - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 3 * 3 - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 1" by simp
  finally show ?thesis .
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_101:
  fixes x :: real
  assumes h0 : "x^2 - 5 * x - 4 \<le> 10"
  shows "x\<ge> -2 \<and> x \<le> 7"
proof -
  have "x^2 - 5 * x - 14 \<le> 0" using assms by simp
  then have "(x - 7) * (x + 2) \<le> 0" by sos
  moreover {
    assume "x < -2"
    then have "x - 7 < -2 - 7" by simp
    then have "(x - 7) * (x + 2) > 0" by sos
  }
  moreover {
    assume "-2 < x" and "x < 7"
    then have "x - 7 < 0" by simp
    then have "(x - 7) * (x + 2) < 0" by (metis \<open>- 2 < x\<close> add_eq_0_iff calculation(1) eq_neg_iff_add_eq_0 less_numeral_extra(3) mult.commute mult_eq_0_iff verit_comp_simplify1(1) verit_comp_simplify1(3) verit_la_disequality)
  }
  moreover {
    assume "x > 7"
    then have "x - 7 > 0" by simp
    then have "(x - 7) * (x + 2) > 0" by simp
  }
  ultimately have "(x - 7) * (x + 2) \<le> 0" by auto
  then show ?thesis by sos
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_433:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * sqrt (2 * x -7) - 8"
  shows "f 8 = 1"
proof -
  have "f 8 = 3 * sqrt (2 * 8 - 7) - 8" using h0 by auto
  also have "... = 3 * sqrt 9 - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 3 * 3 - 8" by simp
  also have "... = 9 - 8" by simp
  finally show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_480:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. x<0 \<Longrightarrow> f x = -(x^2)-1"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (0 \<le> x \<and> x < 4) \<Longrightarrow> f x = 2"
    and h2 : "\<And>x. x\<ge>4 \<Longrightarrow> f x = sqrt x"
  shows "f pi = 2"
proof -
  have c0:"pi \<ge> 0" by simp
  have c1:"0 \<le> pi" using c0 by simp
  have c2:"pi < 4" using pi_less_4 by auto
  have "f pi = 2" using h1[of pi] c1 c2 by auto
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_480':
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. x<0 \<Longrightarrow> f x = -(x^2)-1"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (0 \<le> x \<and> x < 4) \<Longrightarrow> f x = 2"
    and h2 : "\<And>x. x\<ge>4 \<Longrightarrow> f x = sqrt x"
  shows "f pi = 2"
proof -
  have "f pi = 2" using h1[of pi] by (simp add: pi_ge_zero pi_less_4)
  then show ?thesis by simp
qed

theorem mathd_algebra_433:

  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. f x = 3 * sqrt (2 * x -7) - 8"

proof -

  also have "... = 1" by auto
  finally show ?thesis .

theorem mathd_algebra_480:
  fixes f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
  assumes h0 : "\<And>x. x<0 \<Longrightarrow> f x = -(x^2)-1"
    and h1 : "\<And>x. (0 \<le> x \<and> x < 4) \<Longrightarrow> f x = 2"
    and h2 : "\<And>x. x\<ge>4 \<Longrightarrow> f x = sqrt x"
  shows "f pi = 2"
proof -
  have "pi < 4" using pi_less_4 by auto

  thus ?thesis by simp
qed
